link.name: ( IMAGE Team / GREYC Laboratory - CNRS UMR 6072 )

note.text:
This plug-in is based on our open-source libraries G'MIC and
CImg (C++ Template Image Processing Library),
available at:

If you appreciate G'MIC, you are welcome to send us a nice postcard from your place, at:
David Tschumperlé, Laboratoire GREYC (CNRS UMR 6072), Equipe Image,
6 Bd du Maréchal Juin, 14050 Caen Cedex / France.

We would like to thank all these people who contributed to G'MIC in one way or another.
A big hug to :
- Sylvie Alexandre (packaging, testing & filters)

Gmicky is the name of the G'MIC mascot.
He is a small and cute tiger who knows how to do magic.
Gmicky is a tiger, i.e. fast, agile and elegant, just as the G'MIC code is :).
As many magicians, Gmicky knows lot of gimmicks,
and he is a direct and friendly companion of
the ImageMagick's wizard, or the GraphicMagick's frog.

Roddy is another mascot designed specifically for the
Artistic / Rodilius filter of G'MIC.
Gmicky and Roddy have been both created and drawn by

bool.name: Output Each Piece on a Different Layer

note.text:
Authors: Lyle Kroll, Angelo Lama and David Tschumperlé.
Latest Update: 2011/28/02.

link.name: Click here for a video tutorial

note.text: Check if you wish visual control on this step

choice.name: Stretch Contrast
choice.choice3: Manual Controls") note = note ("To activate the sliders below chose 'Manual Controls'

link.name: Forum thread about the filter discussion

note.text:
Note:
This filter simulates different types of colorblindness vision.

Manual estimation:
Use the sliders below to target as much skin pixels as you can.

Note: This filter implements the Multiscale Color Retinex algorithm,
as described in:

Note: If parameter Kernel is set to Custom, it uses the custom
convolution kernel defined below. Use commas and semicolons as separators for res. matrix columns and rows.

Note: Kernel multiplier is useful only when parameter Value range is set
to Cut.

Parameters Density, Radius, Variability and Random seed
are used only in Procedural shapes mode.

This filter implements the mapping functions described in this page,
by C. Fong:

You can specify your own depth-of-field image, as a bottom layer image
whose luminance encodes the depth for each pixel.
Don't forget to modify the Input layers combo-box to make this layer active for the filter.

This filter simulates the JPEG compression artifacts,
using DCT quantization on 8x8 blocs.

Note:
This filter implements one version of the algorithm described here :
This effect has been done following:

Note:
This filter is inspired by the original GIMP Unsharp Mask filter, with additional parameters.

bool.name: Add Alpha Channels to Detail Scale Layers

note.text:
Note: This filter decomposes an image into several detail scales,
using wavelet atrous.
It should provide similar results to the
Wavelet Decompose Plug-in
(by Marco Rossini).

Note:
If you set the parameter Shape to Custom layers, the different shapes used to map
the pixel intensities will be defined as
the Number of scales top layers of your image. Don't forget to set also Input layers to
All to be sure
these layers are passed to the filter.

This filter has been inspired by
this tutorial
from DeviantArt user fence-post.

Note: This set of anisotropic smoothing parameters has been suggested
by PhotoComiX.
Note: Add a top layer to define object texture.
Note: Add a top layer to define object texture.
Note: Add a top layer to define object texture.

Note :
Use variable X instead of x in the above equation to take care of the X-min/max settings.
Variable c refers to the current channel number.
Variable u refers to a uniformly distributed random value in [0,1].
Reduce resolution to be able to view
separate graph vertices.

preset.name: Discrete Cosine Transform
preset.command:
N=$1 M={1+$2} Q={1.5*$3} if {narg($_xBlock)==0} _xBlock=0 _yBlock=0 fi if {$_b==1} _xBlock=$_x _yBlock=$_y fi _xBlock={min($_xBlock,w-$N*$M)} _yBlock={min($_yBlock,h-$N*$M)} +crop $_xBlock,$_yBlock,{$_xBlock+$N*$M},{$_yBlock+$N*$M} rectangle[0] $_xBlock,$_yBlock,{$_xBlock+$N*$M},{$_yBlock+$N*$M},1,0xFFFFFFFF,0,0,0 rectangle[0] {$_xBlock+1},{$_yBlock+1},{$_xBlock+$N*$M-1},{$_yBlock+$N*$M-1},1,0xFFFFFFFF,255,255,255 rectangle[0] {$_xBlock+2},{$_yBlock+2},{$_xBlock+$N*$M-2},{$_yBlock+$N*$M-2},0.33,128,128,128 [-1] local[-1] split_tiles $M,$M apply_parallel "-jpeg_action "$Q append_tiles $M,$M endl resize[-2,-1] {0,h},{0,h},1,3,1 append x
jpeg_quantize: repeat $! l[$>] [0],[0],1,[0],1+$1*(x+y) /[0] [1] round[0] * endl done
jpeg_action: repeat $! l[$>] rgb2ycbcr dct round jpeg_quantize $1 idct ycbcr2rgb endl done

preset.name: Fourier filtering
